sense.name: turn, twist or fasten (as if) with a screw
sense.examples: He screwed the boards together tightly. Uncle Dan screwed the top of the base frame to the carcass rather than nailing it. She clasped him round the neck, as he screwed the wings and flew upwards.

sense.name: mess with (someone); cheat someone; waste time
sense.examples: He screwed the American workers in order pay back his political benefactors. Kennedy was killed because he screwed the mob and then fed families. I don't care if she screwed the entire population of Italy, she got the money. There are a thousand hilarious ways to screw with people's heads. Dude, stop screwing around! We're late!

sense.name: SCREW UP: make more intense
sense.examples: Emotions were screwed up by the recent deaths.

sense.name: SCREW UP: make a mess of; ruin
sense.examples: How SUVs screwed up the idea of hybrids. Who screwed up the Indians' World Series Chances? The president screwed up the Middle East, then he screwed up America, and now he wants to screw up Europe.

sense.name: have sex with
sense.examples: As a freshman, she screwed more guys than most seniors. All young people want to do these days is screw around.
